question.text: What does FERPA stand for?
question.option: Federal Educational Rights and Privacy Act

question.text: In order to conduct daily business, schools must record, maintain, and share a great deal of information about students.
FERPA is a federal act intended to:
question.option: Dictate teaching policy across educational institutions
Define the rights of students regarding their education records
Provide requirements and guidelines for educational institutions regarding students' education records
Protect the privacy and accuracy of student records

question.text: Which answer is NOT true when considering who must comply with the regulations set forth in FERPA?
question.option: Only departments within the educational institution that are specifically in charge of maintaining student records
Everyone on campus who has access to student information

question.text: Non-compliance in ANY department on campus can mean a loss of federal funding for the ENTIRE institution.
Which office is in charge of enforcing FERPA?
If a FERPA violation occurs, your school is allowed a reasonable amount of time to correct the situation and return to compliance.
FERPA describes an "eligible student" as
question.option: A student who is at least 18 AND is attending a postsecondary school
A student who is at least 18 OR is attending a postsecondary school
A student who is at least 16

question.text: Under FERPA, your institution can determine when rights begin for new and incoming students, however FERPA states that "student status" cannot begin any later than the first day of classes.
What are the guaranteed rights of students regarding their education records?
question.option: Right to inspect and review records
Right to seek to amend records
Right to inspect ANY piece of information related to their records

question.text: Education institutions are required under FERPA to inform students of their rights, but they are not obligated to inform students about the procedure for exercising those rights.
Requests for inspection of student records must be granted within how many days of the request?
A person can access any student's record as long as he or she is employed by the education institution.
Which of the following is information that may be part of a student's record, but is NOT ACCESSIBLE to the student?
question.option: None of the above - students have the right to view ALL of their records

question.text: Under FERPA, institutions are NOT PERMITTED to:
question.option: Require students to pay search and retrieval fees
Decide what information they can release as "directory information"
Withhold the viewing of transcripts until an outstanding financial obligation is paid

question.text: Under FERPA, students have the right to seek amendment to records they believe to be misleading or inaccurate. Which of the following apply to this right:
question.option: Students must be given the opportunity for a formal hearing
Students must be advised of the appeal process
Hearings must be held within a reasonable amount of time
Hearings must be conducted by someone who doesn't have direct interest in the outcome

question.text: Which is true about information submitted anonymously as part of a student's record?
question.option: All information provided to the institution must be considered part of a student's record
Institutions should never keep anonymous records that make it impossible to trace the source of the information and therefore amend a student's record
Anonymous records automatically become law enforcement records

question.text: Students have the right to amend ALL parts of their education record, including those records that were transferred to the institution (not created by the institution).
FERPA does not dictate guidelines for handling amendments to grades. Your school should establish its own policy to deal with grade disputes.
Which of the following terms is best defined as "the kind of information or data from which the identity of a specific person can be determined?"
Which of the following terms is best defined as "information contained in an education record that would not generally be considered harmful or an invasion of privacy if disclosed?"
Students have the right over the disclosure of personally identifiable information, but cannot request that ALL information regarding their status as a student be withheld.

It is nearing the end of the semester and Professor Botkin posts a class photo on a bulletin board outside his office door. His particular school has listed photographs as "directory information" and can therefore be shared throughout the campus community. Does Professor Botkin need to worry about violating student rights in this case?
question.option: No, the school has designated photos of students as directory information, so students' rights are not being violated.
No, posting information about students in an educational setting (such as outside a professor's doorway) is acceptable under FERPA.
Yes, a student in the photograph may have requested a "FERPA Restriction" (that ALL of his or her information be withheld) and this would include a photograph or any other directory information.
Yes, FERPA specifically restricts the public sharing of group photographs.

question.text: Parents who pay for their child's postsecondary tuition are always entitled to view his or her education records.
Parents of postsecondary students who are under the age of 18 are always entitled to view their child's education records.
Under FERPA, educational institutions are allowed to grant parents access to student records according to which of the following circumstances?
question.option: The student is a considered a dependent for income tax purposes
The student is being supported by his or her parents financially
Notification of drug and alcohol violations in cases where the student was found guilty and is under the age of 21
The parent is part of the school's alumni

question.text: Which of the following terms is best defined as "any record which contains personally identifiable information of a student AND is maintained by an educational institution or by a party acting for the institution?"
Which of the following pieces of information would NOT be considered personally identifiable information?
Which of the following are NOT considered education records and are therefore NOT subject to the privacy protections of FERPA?
question.option: Employment Records (unless the employee is required to be a student)

question.text: Sole possession records are private notes about students intended to help jog the memory of the maker of the records and can be shared with other education officials.
Alumni records (records created AFTER the student has graduated) are NOT considered "education records."

To save time, Professor Green asks his students to switch papers and grade each other's work. After the class is finished, he reads each student's name aloud and publically asks for the grade. Is this considered a FERPA violation?
question.option: Yes, grades are considered part of a student's education record and are therefore protected under FERPA.
Yes, grades on peer-graded assignments before they are collected and officially recorded by the instructor are considered part of the student's education record.

No, grades only become part of a student's education record once they have been recorded and maintained by the instructor. At the time of the public vocalization, the grades were not considered education records, so there is no violation.

question.text: With a few exceptions, FERPA allows each school to determine what information it will publically share as "directory information."
Which of the following information can NEVER be released as directory information?
Which of the following is an example of an instance when the institution does NOT need prior written consent to disclose records?
question.option: In cases of legitimate educational interest
Releasing results of a disciplinary hearing to a victim of crime

question.text: Which of the following terms can be defined as "an employee who has responsibilities for the creation, maintenance, and disclosure of information from education records?"
It is not important to know your school's policies and definitions regarding the sharing of student information as long as you are fully aware of the guidelines outlined in FERPA.
Which of the following is NOT considered a responsibility of the learning institution?
question.option: Maintain practices to ensure privacy of students' records
Define terms that affect local privacy practices and FERPA compliance
Check in with the Family Policy Compliance Office on an annual basis
Publish an annual notification informing students of their privacy rights under FERPA

question.text: According to FERPA, which of the following must be included in the institution's annual notification?
question.option: The four primary guarantees/rights given to students under FERPA
The procedure for exercising students' rights
Definitions of "school official" and "legitimate educational interest"
Policies and practices of sharing and utilizing students' information, including what the school classifies as "directory information"
Disclosure of policies regarding teaching methods and the assignment of grades
